snippet: Known as a pugnacious reactionary, Justice Scalia had strong opinions about his boyhood borough, stickball, the melting pot and “Joe Sixpack.”
abstract: Justice Antonin Scalia, appointed to Supreme Court in 1986, considered himself, in spirit and at heart, a Queens man; Scalia spent much of his childhood in Elmhurst, and retained number of New York friendships throughout his life and career.

byline.contributor: Sarah Maslin Nir and Jeffrey E. Singer contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Known as a pugnacious reactionary, Justice Scalia had strong opinions about his boyhood borough, stickball, the melting pot and “Joe Sixpack.”

headline.main: In Queens, Antonin Scalia Took Pride in Melting Pot and Confrontation
headline.print_headline: Taking Pride in Diversity and Confrontation
